message.content:
{"id": "18934", 
 "title": "Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example", 
 "description": "When opening the ImageAnalyzer example in Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only), the scrollbars are enabled. However, when attempting to move them, they do not have any effect. This is particularly misleading when opening a small image, like an icon, as the scrollbars give the impression that they can be used to view the entire image.", 
 "OB": "Open the ImageAnalyzer example. Notice that the scrollbars are enabled and can be moved around, but they do not have any effect when attempting to scroll. This issue occurs in Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only).", 
 "EB": "", 
 "SR": "The scrollbars in the ImageAnalyzer example should be disabled to prevent confusion. When opening the example, users should not be able to move the scrollbars or have any expectation that they will have any effect on the image display. This should be fixed in Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only)." }
